metadata.title: CVE-2016-7502 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The cavs_idct8_add_c function in libavcodec/cavsdsp.c in FFmpeg before3.1.4 is vulnerable to reading out-of-bounds memory when decoding withcavs_decode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
